page.title: 07SUPERNATURAL
page.content: The Vestry of Barking Church is reputed to be haunted by a "Grey Lady", (supposed to have been a nun), as is the area around the Church and the old Barking Hall. The Old Hall Stables are haunted by something that re-arranges objects. Barking Hall when standing had a ghost in the Countess's bedroom. A coachman from the Hall is reputed to have hanged himself from an oak that formerly grew directly in front of the stables, and he haunts this area. A headless coachman drives a coach and two horses up Parson's Lane to the Church or Rectory. Two ghosts have been seen walking from the Old Rectory to the Church.
